ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: how to observe photographs from past/influential photographers, how to take photos by considering aperture and shutter speed, how to capture and edit light in photos, and how to print digital photos!

Camera use and other hardware
Photography software
Focus
Photoshop

Before this class, I thought photography was all about form, technical skills, composition, lighting, etc. People always said my photos were great, so why not sign up for a photography class, right? I thought Id learn how to take better photos, and I did. But it was what I learned beyond that that made it so much more of an experience. We learned skills in photoshop which I wish I had known for the thousands of other photos Ive taken. We learned how to give constructive critiques to our peers and incorporate their critiques in our own efforts. 

Most importantly, I learned that photography isnt just a medium to capture a moment in time, its also *art*. Through this class, I expanded my understanding of what it means to be an artist, not just a photographer. We looked through several various artists photos and went outside the classroom to the archives and galleries as well.
I learnt a lot about editing pictures and printing
I learned basic knowledge of how to use a digital camera and edit photos.

This course taught me how to take a digital photograph - using shutter speed, adjusting the lighting, etc. I also developed my skills in Camera RAW, Photoshop, and printing. We studied photography history and got to look through past Yale Art School graduates' portfolios.
I learned all about photoshop which I knew nothing about prior to the course!
I learned how to use a digital camera as well as basic photo editing skills in Photoshop
I improved my digital camera using skills and editing digital photos.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: this class provides a lot of freedom to explore photography as a medium. ted is a very chill professor, so it makes it a fun and relaxed environment for learning and artistic expression. 
weaknesses: there could be a bit more time to learn how to print, as we definitely did rush a little bit at the end of the year. i also think the paper was quite expensive, so i wish it would have been provided.

The professor is awesome. The only improvement I would make is to add more time to the class, but that likely isnt feasible. The class really needs a lab section so that during the two classes a week, we can study and present art, but on the lab day, we work in lab on our photos.
Great course
Strengths were the professor! I loved the way Ted taught this course. It challenged me and my peers to take different kinds of photos and edit.

The class was very enjoyable and got me to get out into the New Haven community to take photographs. The class could have been better split between class time to take photographs and working in the lab. Sometimes the class periods ran a little long, and I ran out of stuff to do.
Strengths: allows people to really be creative unlike other courses, also teaches us skill that will directly translate in other aspects of life

Strengths: very pleasant and thoughtful conversations; crits are super fun, and Ted and Davion were really kind and helpful when asked for help.
Weakness: more structure is needed in the course, more emphasis in the actual practice of photographing
It's a really great chance to take your interest in photography to the next level! You have the freedom to work on the projects you want
i loved the opportunities for feed back and space for creative work and personal development

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes! i think this class was a lot of fun, and it provided a really nice outlet for me to express myself artistically. highly recommend to anyone, especially a stem student who wants a class that is different from everything else they are taking.
Yes. Ted is the best. The classroom environment is accommodating, unpretentious, and suitable for beginners. A great class to kickstart acquiring the skill of digital photography.

I recommend it to people are genuinely interested not just in photography as a skill, but in learning about photography as an art form. Its a very hard class to get into, so I recommend making sure you understand and can effectively communicate your why. Also, be open minded. You may not like a lot of the art you see, but if you stay open, youll discover why the photographers are famous.
YES, love photography great course
Yes, if you are even remotely interested in photography, please take this course.

I would recommend this course to students interested in any art form. Although I was not a photographer before this course, learning how to train my eye through the camera lens helped me develop my skills as a visual artist.
Yes absolutely. This course was so refreshing and I loved everything about it. A very warm and comfortable working and learning environment.
yes
I would definitely recommend it because it is very good to start learning digital photography basics.
Yes!
take this course its amazing
